SEARCH
Package ie.atu.sw

Class ProcessSentimentVT

java.lang.Object
ie.atu.sw.ProcessSentimentVT
public class ProcessSentimentVT extends Object
Sentiment Analysis done here using the thread safe concurrent resources and virtual threads

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ProcessSentimentVT(String inputFilePath, int tweetLine, String lexiconFilePath)
    This is the constructor for ProcessSentimentVT.java it takes the 3 file paths entered from the user and stores them into variables that have gets and sets

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    calculateSentimentValue()
    this method gets each word and calls another method that gets its sentiment value, then it adds it to a data structure then it calls a method that then uses this to calculate the average of these sentiment values and prints it for the user

  • Constructor Details

    • ProcessSentimentVT

      public ProcessSentimentVT(String inputFilePath, int tweetLine, String lexiconFilePath)
      This is the constructor for ProcessSentimentVT.java it takes the 3 file paths entered from the user and stores them into variables that have gets and sets
      Parameters:
      inputFilePath - this contains a path to a file filled with words the user will want to calculate the sentiment value of
      tweetLine - this contains a path to a file that will contain the results and analysis report calculated
      lexiconFilePath - this contains the path of the desired lexicon file the user would like to read from

  • Method Details

    • readLexicon

      public void readLexicon() throws Throwable
      Generally this method job is to get the lexicon to read each line in as a stream to ensure smooth reading in and for each line it forks to ensure concurrent processing of the lines then it call the isolateWordAndValueFromLexicon(line); which will then process each line.
      Throws:
      Throwable - in case the try clause fails

    • isolateWordAndValueFromLexicon

      public void isolateWordAndValueFromLexicon(String line)
      make a method to single out the word before the comma and read in every value after the comma with no whitespace
      Parameters:
      line - is a line of text from the lexicon

    • readInputFile

      public void readInputFile() throws Throwable
      This method reads the file that contains the stuff the user wants to be analyzed
      Throws:
      Throwable

    • storeEachTweetLine

      public void storeEachTweetLine(String line)
      This takes the whole line and puts it into the allTweets map with an index as it's key so when we need to check which line the user has entered we can obtain it easily
      Parameters:
      line - a line from the file the user wanted analyzed

    • isolateTweetWordByWord

      public void isolateTweetWordByWord(String line)
      separates each word from the line and adds each word into tweetWordSet as separate records to make calculation possible
      Parameters:
      line - needs the line of text to isolate words from

    • calculateSentimentValue

      public void calculateSentimentValue() throws Throwable
      this method gets each word and calls another method that gets its sentiment value, then it adds it to a data structure then it calls a method that then uses this to calculate the average of these sentiment values and prints it for the user
      Throws:
      Throwable

    • processWord

      public double processWord(String word)
      this is the finding of a given word sentiment value from the lexicon map
      Parameters:
      word - needs the word to check if it is in the lexicon
      Returns:
      0 when the value is not in the lexicon, or return a matched value

    • getAverageSentimentValue

      public double getAverageSentimentValue()
      This averages all of the values in the tweetSentimentValues collection
      Returns:
      the average sentiment

    • go

      public void go() throws Exception
      called in the runner classes' main method this .go() method makes virtual threads and forks them and kick-starts the process of the calculating and data reading concurrently
      Throws:
      Exception
